channel.title: JBoss Issue Tracker
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [ENTESB-6194] suspended/resumed camel activemq route stops consuming
item.description:
The following sequence of events causes an ActiveMQ consumer to no longer consume messages:
1) A camel route that is an ActiveMQ consumer is suspended via the 'controlbus' component
2) A timeout is generated during the suspension due to in-flight messages
3) The camel route is resumed via the 'controlbus' component
4) The camel route no longer consumes ActiveMQ messages, even though messages are still enqueued.

Blueprint

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
 
<blueprint xmlns="http://www.osgi.org/xmlns/blueprint/v1.0.0" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
 
	xsi:schemaLocation="
 
       http://www.osgi.org/xmlns/blueprint/v1.0.0 http://www.osgi.org/xmlns/blueprint/v1.0.0/blueprint.xsd
 
       http://camel.apache.org/schema/blueprint http://camel.apache.org/schema/blueprint/camel-blueprint.xsd">
 
 
 
	<bean id="activemq" class="org.apache.activemq.camel.component.ActiveMQComponent">
 
		<property name="brokerURL" value="tcp://localhost:61616" />
 
	</bean>
 
 
 
	<bean id="shutdown" class="org.apache.camel.impl.DefaultShutdownStrategy">
 
		<property name="timeout" value="5"></property>
 
	</bean>
 
 
 
	<camelContext id="myctx-01" xmlns="http://camel.apache.org/schema/blueprint">
 
 
 
		<route id="enqueueMsgs" >
 
			<from uri="timer:foo?period=10&repeatCount=10" />
 
			<log message="enqueue message" />
 
			<to pattern="InOnly" uri="activemq:queue:myqueue?username=admin&password=admin" />
 
		</route>
 
 
 
		<route id="dequeueMsgs">
 
			<from uri="activemq:queue:myqueue?username=admin&password=admin" />
 
			<log message="dequeue message start" />
 
			<delay>
 
				<constant>15000</constant>
 
			</delay>
 
			<log message="dequeue message stop" />
 
		</route>
 
 
 
		<route id="suspendRestartRoutes">
 
			<from uri="timer:foo?period=5000&delay=5000" />
 
			<to uri="controlbus:route?routeId=dequeueMsgs&action=suspend" />
 
			<to uri="controlbus:route?routeId=dequeueMsgs&action=resume" />
 
		</route>
 
 
 
	</camelContext>
 
 
 
</blueprint>
item.summary: suspended/resumed camel activemq route stops consuming

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
A reproducer is attached which can be installed in a Fuse instance. Sample output is below:

Using stop/start via controlbus causes the consumer to continue dequeuing messages
